data.title: Delicious pizza
data.text: Love the Build it Yourself option that I can share half with husband.  The ingredients are fresh and veggies delicious as well as the toppings.

data.title: Keeps Calling Me Back!
data.text: Blaze is more than a meal, it's an experience.  If you're a fan of pizza "your way" this is your spot.  Fresh, delicious ingredients assembled just the way you like and cooked to perfection.  Eat here once and it's the only pizza you'll ever want!

data.title: Family Dinner
data.text: It was too hot to cook dinner and stay jome. So, we went to Blaze Pizza at the Orange Circle.  My kids told me about it and thought it was a perfect time to try it out. Not disappointed.  My custom pizza was absolutely delicious.

data.title: Fun place
data.text: Good place to grab a bite in Old Towne. Blood orange lemonade is excellent. Service was best part, as these employees seem to enjoy what they are doing.

data.title: Need some 'za?
data.text: We discovered this little gem while vacationing. When we walked in, we were greeted instantly and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The pizza was super tasty and very fresh. Also, very reasonable prices. The decor was cool too

data.title: Custom made!
data.text: Walk down the aisle and the friendly pizza makers will put as many toppings as you select on your inexpensive custom made pizza.  One price under $9 and we load it up with a dozen toppings.  Great value. Also love their Blood Orange Lemonade.  You must try Blaze if you're a pizza lover!  They bake it super fast too.

data.title: Crisp and fresh!
data.text: My favorite kind of pizza:  thin, crisp crust with chewy edges, light hand on the sauce, fresh mozzarella, fresh basil.  Perfectly cooked.  And, all the combinations they offer sound great, plus you can design your own.  They have this machine that presses the dough paper-thin, the toppings go on, and then it's popped into this super-hot oven.  You wait -- but not very long -- and it's ready!  We're regulars for take-out, and it's still hot when we get it home.

data.title: Pizza snob gives thumbs up
data.text:
Blaze at Orange Plaza is my new fave pizza parlor.
Excellent thin crust pizza cooked to perfection every time. Extensive toppings selection. Staff is efficient & super accommodating. And you can't beat Old Town Orange for location.
The reasons I didn't give 5 stars 1) noise level 2) no plates, even for salads.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: I love these "build it yourself" pizza places. They have lots of menu items and you can either customize it or completely build your own. You get in line and order kind of Subway style...tell them what kind of crust you want and what ingredients as you go down the line. They are super efficient and quick. You pay at the end while you watch them slide your pizzas into the oven. In no time at all, they either bring them out (we sat outside with the dog) or they call your name. The pizza was great! Thin crust (LOVE!) great fresh ingredients and very tasty! We had a green stripe (I think that was the name) and a red vine (again, I think that was it) and we added a few ingredients on each. Delicious. We saved a couple pieces each and had leftovers the next day at home. Just as delicious that day! The chairs outside are bright orange and so cute but a tiny bit uncomfortable. Other than that, no complaints! We will be back.

data.title: Freshest pizza ever!
data.text: Nice place on the Circle in Orange.  The pizza was excellent.  It tasted like all the ingredients were fresh and the best part was the thin crust.  Definitely will go again some day.

data.title: Blazin' Good Pizza
data.text: There are 3 pizza places within a 2 block radius here in Old Towne. We prefer Blaze, although Pizza Press is pretty much right up there with them. It's only a little over $8 for an individual pizza (I guess 2 people could share one) and you pretty much can choose the topping(s) you like. I love their spicy sauce. Don't put much 'veggie' toppers on or your pizza dough tends to become soggy. The staff are friendly, the place is always clean and the price is great.

data.title: Lunch Break
data.text: Coming from New York I wanted to see what this PiZza was like. I was pleasantly surprised I really enjoyed it. For $8.45 you can totally customize your PiZza from sauce to meat to veggie toppings. The crust was nice and crunchy.

data.title: Quickly becoming my favorite "build your own" pizza!
data.text: I love Blaze Pizza!  I love the fact that I can build my own pizza, and I love the fact that they have some yummy white sauce that I like to put on my pizza.  (not every build your own has white sauce).   I also like this location at the Orange "circle".  Just a nice place to visit and it is not too expensive as some of the restaurants in that area are.  I will be back!

data.title: Great pizza in a noisy store,
data.text: Delicious gourmet thin-crust pizzas are custom made to order in assembly line fashion and fast-baked in a 530 degree oven. The final product is ready in about three minutes. The restaurant is appointed in a nice modern industrial style. The lack of ceiling tiles results in a rather noisy environment not really conducive to good digestion or lingering, although the nice selection of beers might be influential. I like this place...and prices are quite reasonable.

data.title: Great single serve pizzas!
data.text: I like the barbecue chicken pizza best. My son usually gets the cheese pizza. The crust is thin. It is enough for one person or you can save half and take it home. They also have take out and you can call in your order and they cook it as soon as you arrive. It is very fast because they use an extremely hot oven.

data.title: Good, clean, reasonbly priced at a great location
data.text:
Went to Blaze Pizza in historic downtown Orange on Feb 8 2016 for an early dinner. I visited Blaze Pizza in Carlsbad outlet mall for the first time last December and this location was even better. I can't comment on the responsiveness of the process since I was one of probably 10 people in the place (it was about 5:00pm on a Monday) but the staff were friendly, competent, and very accommodating while answering my questions about how the pizza building process worked. 

The pizza was delicious, I ordered a garden salad along with my pizza which was very good but I would have liked the vinaigrette dressing a little thinner to pour easier on the salad. But overall I was very pleased with the food and the value.

data.title: Teriyaki Chicken Pizza
data.text:
We went there with friends. The chicken fresh and real thin pizza. nice table and chairs.
Good view of a center park, a wedding going on. Teriyaki sauce good. Only napkins no plates. nice antique stores and shops around. We had fun.Would go again when in area.

data.title: Worth the Wait/Worth the Weight
data.text: It took a little while for their opening to settle down so lines weren't like the kind outside a rock concert. Blaze can now be enjoyed and savored any night of the week, and it's been well worth the wait (or weight, depending on your appetite). Chose your own toppings? What could be a better pizza than the one you design? Tell the friendly staffer what you'd like to devour, and they'll put as much or as little on as you'd like, all for the same reasonable price. The ingredients are fantastic, so if you don't like your meal you're the only one to point the finger at. Get in there now before their next rush begins, and don't forget to grab a s'more cookie or two on the way out the door.

data.title: Perfect Place for a Pizza Fix
data.text: I was in town for Chapman University's homecoming/parents weekend.  I wanted to experience all of the best local places.  Blaze Pizza is the pizza restaurant of choice in Orange for my daughter.  Your pizza is made to order and oven/fired.  It is a thin crust pizza.  I loved the ambiance of the interior.  The dark brown woods and rectangular dining area made the experience very hip.  The pizza did not disappoint and I was just in Chicago last week enjoying deep dish.  This pizza has a crunch to it and with your favorite toppings you'll be truly satisfied.

data.title: Fired Up!
data.text:
Orange has a home town feel surrounded by fantastic restaurants and scenery.  Just walking around the historic area and the circle, you can smell the delicious aromatic blend of food culture.  Blaze Pizza is among this unique place and the wood fired pizza is wonderful. 

The restaurant rests and faces the inner circle.  There is a perfect view of the center park and fountain from the tables outside and inside the restaurant.  The restaurant has an open kitchen with an industrial flare.  The size of the place creates a noisy atmosphere, as the place is busy (very good sign).  You're greeted by a pizza maker, cafeteria style, and you create your own pizza or order from the diverse menu.

Your pizza creation is placed in the oven in full view.  You can watch the dough bubble up and the toppings letting off steam.  It only takes a couple of minutes.  This pizza is placed on a parchment lined tray and handed over, but not without mentioning an offer for dessert; a wood fired s'more!  

The pizza is wood fired magic!  The crust reveals a delightful and flexible crust with a hint of crunch.  The fresh toppings are cooked to perfection.   The size of the pie could be compared to a jumbo tortilla.

I'm so stoked and ready to go here again for a delicious meal.  It is fast food at its finest!  So, get fired up and enjoy the historic town of Orange and have a meal at Blaze Pizza.
